steps.details: Alert motorists and residents about hail and strong gusts; recommend sheltering in place.
Advise reduced speeds on flyovers and open stretches to prevent loss-of-control incidents.
Encourage drivers to move under cover where possible and avoid stopping on flyovers.
Ready towing and first-aid teams for expected increase in minor accidents.
Forestry/BBMP crews to monitor vulnerable trees for falling branches triggered by hail winds.

plan.plan_title: Vehicle Damage & Pile-ups on Hebbal Flyover

steps.details: Police to cordon off areas of pile-up and route traffic around the incident.
Ambulances to prioritise injured; establish triage at safe nearby locations.
Tow trucks to remove damaged vehicles and clear ramps to restore flow.
Set up temporary warning lights and signs to alert following traffic of hazards.
Provide information kiosks for quick reporting and support for affected motorists.
BESCOM to isolate affected overhead lines to prevent further failures and ensure crew safety.
Maintain power to hospitals and emergency services by controlled load-shedding of non-critical areas.
Send line maintenance teams to repair fallen lines and restore stable supply.
Inform residents and businesses about outage extent, safety precautions, and restoration timeline.
Coordinate with BBMP for rapid removal of fallen trees causing line damage.
